title: Upazila
summary: Upazila (Bengali: উপজেলা, romanized: upôzela, lit. 'sub-district' pronounced: ['upodʒela]), formerly called Thana, is an administrative region in Bangladesh, functioning as a sub-unit of a district. It can be seen to be analogous to a county or a borough of a Western country. Rural upazilas are further administratively divided into union council areas (Union Parishads).
